meanings.definition: Cause extreme pain, distress, or anguish to
meanings.sent1: The loud noise wracked my head with pain.
meanings.sent2: The loss of her pet wracked her with sadness.
meanings.sent3: The spicy food wracked his taste buds with surprise.
meanings.sent4: The haunting memories wracked her heart with sorrow.
meanings.sent5: The piercing scream wracked the silence of the night.

meanings.sent1: The storm wracked the old house with destruction.
meanings.sent2: The earthquake wracked the city with chaos.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy wracked the garden with mess.
meanings.sent4: The virus wracked his computer with errors.
meanings.sent5: The vandals wracked the park with graffiti.

meanings.sent1: The bully wracked him with fear every day.
meanings.sent2: The evil villain wracked the hero with doubts.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous ghost wracked the old mansion with pranks.
meanings.sent4: The tricky riddle wracked her brain with confusion.
meanings.sent5: The suspenseful movie wracked the audience with anticipation.
